body:
![My Picture](https://d13pix9kaak6wt.cloudfront.net/background/users/c/h/r/christin_jose_1431837730_82.jpg)

### Christin Jose
I'm a CS graduate student at Rutgers, New Brunswick and I work as Research Assistant for a data science research project. I like studying about machine learning, data mining and recommendation systems. This semester i will be working for a startup as a programmer under three prominent Professors from Rutgers and NYU.

### Areas of Interest
I am passionate about coding. Currently i am attending interviews to get into a company where i could use my skills and develop new. My favorite language is C, Java and Python in the order of interest. I develop cool android apps to help my friends to travel, to explore. The app which i am currently developing is about soft routing. Other areas which i am interested are improvement of the algorithm of common mapping/routing applications so that they could give the best route to a search. Presently it is observed that all the common applications give different route and ETA for the same start and destination.

### Current Capacity
Currently I am working as in a Team Lead capacity on an Urban Routing application under the direction of Professor Martin Farach-Colton and Professor Muthu Muthukrishnan. Technologies used are Android, Map Quest open source code, Google Maps API and Python script for scrapping the data. This is a startup venture designed to facilitate pedestrian city navigation and allow the user to take advantage of various highlights that the city has to offer.

### References
